metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7835 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mixed content blocking of insecure (HTTP) sub-resources in a secure (HTTPS) document was not correctly applied for resources that redirect from HTTPS to HTTP, allowing content that should be blocked, such as scripts, to be loaded on a page. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 57.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-testsuite - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
